texts.text: Add, edit or remove your Access Control List settings
Add an ACL target to your oneye system
Add a new filetype to your oneye system
Add a new user to your oneye system
Adds a new task to the Buffer.
Appends a value to an virtual file's content. This function can be perfectly used by any application, but it is specifically thought to be used remotely using oneye' XML-RPC API.
Are you sure you want to delete this ACL?
Are you sure you want to delete this param?
Are you sure you want to delete this target?
Bookmarks and search engines successfully exported.
Calculates the size of a virtual file.
Calls an event function of an application. This function is automatically called every time an application sends a signal from a user's client.
Calls the start function of an already running application.
Changes successfully saved and user updated.
Changes the location of a real file from one location to another.
Changes the name of an virtual file.
Changes the size of an existing widget to the specified width and height.
Changes the value of a widget.
Changes the value of a widget. The given value is supposed to be encoded in base 64.
Changes the wallpaper of the screen.
Checknum of the application executing the action.
Checks if a file has illegal characters in its name.
Checks if a given file or directory is inside of one of the system groups.
Checks if a given path points to a directory.
Checks if a specified real file exists or not.
Checks if a user is a maintainer.
Checks if a virtual file exists.
Checks if the current user is Root.
Checks if the specified user's credentials are correct.
Checks the permissions of a file.
Checks the permissions of a real file.
Checks to see if a user exists.
Checks to see whether the current user has been disabled.
Checks whether a file has the same extension as the one used for storing a virtual file's content (defined by the EYEOS_FILE_EXT constant).
Checks whether a layer exists or not.
Checks whether a process with the given application name exists in the process table and returns its checknum.
Checks whether a process with the given application name exists in the process table and returns its process ID.
Checks whether a process with the given checknum exists and returns all its information of its entry in the process table.
Checks whether a process with the given checknum exists in the process table.
Checks whether a process with the given checknum exists in the process table and returns its application name.
Checks whether a process with the given process ID exists.
Checks whether a process with the given process ID exists and returns all the information of its entry in the process table.
Checks whether a process with the given process ID exists and returns its checknum.
Checks whether a process with the given process ID exists in the process table and returns its application name.
Checks whether a virtual file has the same extension as the one used for storing a virtual file's content (defined by the EYEOS_FILE_EXT constant).
Choose the rendering method for PDF files
Concatenates text to the value property of a widget.
Concatenates text to the value property of a widget. The specified value is encoded in base 64 until it is set.
Concatenates text to the value property of a widget. This function works with Textarea widgets which have been set to contain rich text.
Configure the office support on a Linux server
Configure the office support on a Windows server
Copies a directory and its contents.
Copies a real file to the specified destination.
Copies a virtual file to a specified destination.
Create an ACL rule for your oneye system
Creates a new user, including his/her 'home' directory.
Default group successfully saved. You need to restart your session now.
Deletes a directory and its content.
Deletes a user from the system.
Deletes the contents of a virtual file, leaving it blank.
Displays a dialog to the user with the specified message.
Do you really want to delete the oneye system? This removes all data from oneye' directory!
Do you really want to remove this command?
Do you really want to remove this group from the system?
Do you really want to remove this mirror from eyeSoft?
Do you really want to remove this user from the system?
Do you really want to restore the default eyeDesk settings?
Do you really want to restore the default eyeNav bookmarks?
Do you really want to restore the default eyeNav search?
Draws a new layer and serializes it into the eyeX layer table.
Draws a new layer on the screen, without serializing it in the eyeX layer table.
Draws a new widget in the screen.
Echoes the content of a file. This function is the equivalent of the printFile() function for virtual files.
Echoes the content of a file. This function is the equivalent of the readFile() function for real files.
Edit your eyePictures slideshow related settings
Eliminates a widget from the user's session.
Embeds the specified content inside of an existing layer.
Executes an application by calling its start function. Also adds an entry in the process table.
Executes a specified JS code. Has better content handling than rawjs().
Export default bookmarks and search engines
File cannot be downloaded. Please correct the address.
Gets the content of a user's account file.
Gets the virtual name of a real file.
Hides a layer applying a gradual fade to black effect.
Informations about the available rendering methods
Instead of displaying the PDF files in a window, download them. The browser will then ask you whether you'd like to open them or save them
Language changed. Please restart oneye now.
Loads a CSS file from a specified directory inside the extern folder.
Loads a JS script from a specified URL in the extern folder.
Makes a layer visible and displays it on top of any other layers or windows in the screen.
Makes a virtual file out of a real one without deleting it.
Makes a widget draggable by the user.
Manage the navigator's startpage, bookmarks and search engines
No registered user could be found.
Opens a virtual file and returns a handler to work with.
Please choose a command to be deleted.
Please choose a command to be edited.
Please choose a filetype to be edited.
Please choose a filetype to delete.
Please choose a group to delete.
Please choose a group to edit.
Please choose a group to set it as default group.
Please choose a mirror to be tested.
Please choose a mirror to delete.
Please choose a mirror to edit.
Please choose an ACL to delete
Please choose an ACL to edit from the list
Please choose a parameter to delete
Please choose a target to delete
Please choose a user to be deleted.
Please choose a user to be edited.
Please fill and select all fields
Please fill in all necessary fields!
Please fill in all required fields!
Please fill in and select the proper fields to add params
Please fill out all required fields marked with *.
Please type a correct group name!
Please type in the parameter to filter
Please type the correct root password to uninstall oneye!
Please type your password to remove this account.
Reads a virtual file's info part and returns its contents as an array.
Removes a layer from the user's session.
Remove temporary files and folders from your oneye system
Retrieves a file located in the oneye extern directory.
Returns a handler to work with a file.
Returns a list containing all the users belonging to a specific group.
Returns a list of the groups that the currently logged in user is a member of.
Returns a list of the virtual files found in a directory under the specified search pattern.
Returns a list with all the users registered in the system.
Returns the 'tty' field of a process.
Returns the contents of the output buffer.
Returns the path of a user's directory.
Returns the path to a user's account directory.
Returns the path to the current user's 'home' directory.
Returns the real filename in which a virtual file is stored.
Returns the resolved path to a specified directory. The path can be part of the user's directory or to a group directory.
Returns the size of a file.
Returns the whole process table of a user's session.
Searches the real files in a directory matching a given search pattern.
Seconds to wait between every picture
Select a target from the list to add parameters to
Sends a signal to an application.
Set new password on next login
Sets a CSS property of an element.
Sets the user of a process.
Smooth: Icons can be moved anywhere
Sorry, but that file does not exist.
Sorry, this file is not allowed to be a wallpaper.
Sorry, this page cannot be entered by the default user.
Sorry, this page is not installed.
Sorry, you do not have permissions to enter this page.
Sorry, you need to login as normal user to enter this page.
Sorry, you need to login as this user to enter this page.
Specifies which JavaScript code must be executed every time a widget triggers a JS event.
Temporary files and folders successfully removed.
Terminates an application calling its closing function and removes it from the process table.
The chosen group is already the default group!
The extern service is used to load resources such as images or CSS files from the extern directory. These resources can then be used by applications within oneye.

The eyeX service is responsible for drawing the contents of the page and the manipulation of CSS and JS files. It is also responsible for the control of the layer system, part of which is the 'eyeApps' layer, in which all the applications and the desktop are drawn.
Theme changed. You must restart your desktop for the changes to become active.

The mmap service is a key part of the oneye system that connects the client side with the server side via message passing between the two parts. The messages always consist in an XML string giving instructions of the actions to perform to the part.
The proc service gives the possibility to manage and get information about running processes.
There was a problem while deleting the group.
The selected file is not an eyeNav bookmarks file.
The selected file is not an eyeNav search engine file.
The selected username is too long!
The selected username is too small!
The User Manager service is responsible for managing users and allowing applications to interact with a user's data.

The vfs service is the layer that must be used to manipulate any file inside oneye. It contains two sets of functions to manipulate files: one to work with the user's personal (virtual) files, and the other one (having always a 'real_' prefix on their name) to work with normal (real) files.
Transforms a directory's files to virtual mode. Each real file found will have in the same directory an equivalent file in virtual mode.
Transforms a PHP array into string convertible to a JavaScript array.
Transforms a PHP array into string convertible to a JS array with the use of the JS function getArrayArg.
Type in the parameter you want to filter:
Type the command you want to run at login.
Type the name of the group you want to create:
Unhides a layer applying a gradual fade in effect.
Updates a user's information contained in that user's account file.
Use an HTML5 renderer. It does not require any external plugin. It is still under development, so some PDF files could be wrongly displayed
Used to create a directory in the user's 'home' directory or its descendents.
Username contains invalid characters, please try another!
Use the browser plugin (recommended if your browser has a PDF reader plugin installed)
Windows successfully restored. Please restart the applications now.
Writes the content of a file to a given value. This function is the equivalent of the writeFile() function for virtual files.
Writes the content of an virtual file to a given value. This function is the equivalent of the real_putFileContent() function for real files.
You are not allowed to manage groups!
You are not allowed to manage users!
You cannot delete the default group!
You cannot delete the default mirror!
You cannot delete the root user!
You cannot edit the default mirror!
You cannot save a mirror as the default mirror!
You can use /a (ending), /b (beginning) and /c (counts) to list users.
Your oneye system was successfully deleted.
Your server does not need cleaning!
